Class ServerProfile

public class ServerProfile
extends org.zoolu.tools.Configure

ServerProfile maintains the server configuration.

Field Detail

domain_names

public java.lang.String[] domain_names
The domain names that the server administers.

It lists the domain names for which the Location Service maintains user bindings.
Use 'auto-configuration' for automatic configuration of the domain name.

domain_port_any

public boolean domain_port_any
Whether consider any port as valid local domain port (regardless which sip port is used).

is_registrar

public boolean is_registrar
Whether the Server should act as Registrar (i.e. respond to REGISTER requests).

expires

public int expires
Maximum expires time (in seconds).

register_new_users

public boolean register_new_users
Whether the Registrar can register new users (i.e. REGISTER requests from unregistered users).

is_open_proxy

public boolean is_open_proxy
Whether the Server relays requests for (or to) non-local users.

location_service

public java.lang.String location_service
The type of location service. You can specify the location service type (e.g. local, ldap, radius, mysql) or the class name (e.g. local.server.LocationServiceImpl).

location_db

public java.lang.String location_db
The name of the location DB.

clean_location_db

public boolean clean_location_db
Whether location DB has to be cleaned at startup.

do_authentication

public boolean do_authentication
Whether the Server authenticates local users.

do_proxy_authentication

public boolean do_proxy_authentication
Whether the Proxy authenticates users.

authentication_scheme

public java.lang.String authentication_scheme
The authentication scheme. You can specify the authentication scheme name (e.g. Digest, AKA, etc.) or the class name (e.g. local.server.AuthenticationServerImpl).

authentication_realm

public java.lang.String authentication_realm
The authentication realm. If not defined or equal to 'NONE' (default), the used via address is used instead.

authentication_service

public java.lang.String authentication_service
The type of authentication service. You can specify the authentication service type (e.g. local, ldap, radius, mysql) or the class name (e.g. local.server.AuthenticationServiceImpl).

authentication_db

public java.lang.String authentication_db
The name of the authentication DB.

call_log

public boolean call_log
Whether maintaining a complete call log.

on_route

public boolean on_route
Whether the server should stay in the signaling path (uses Record-Route/Route)

loose_route

public boolean loose_route
Whether implementing the RFC3261 Loose Route (or RFC2543 Strict Route) rule

loop_detection

public boolean loop_detection
Whether checking for loops before forwarding a request (Loop Detection). In RFC3261 it is optional.

phone_routing_rules

public RoutingRule[] phone_routing_rules
Array of RoutingRules based on pairs of username or phone prefix and corresponding nexthop address. It provides static rules for routing number-based SIP-URL the server is responsible for. Use "default" (or "*") as default prefix. Example, request URL sip:01234567@zoopera.com received by a server responsible for domain name 'zoopera.com'. phone_routing_rules={prefix=0123,nexthop=127.0.0.2:7002} {prefix=*,nexthop=127.0.0.3:7003}

domain_routing_rules

public RoutingRule[] domain_routing_rules
Array of RoutingRules based on pairs of destination domain and corresponding nexthop address. It provides static rules for routing domain-based SIP-URL the server is NOT responsible for. It make the server acting (also) as 'Interrogating' Proxy, i.e. I-CSCF in the 3G networks. Example, domain_routing_rules={domain=wonderland.net,nexthop=neverland.net:5060}
